creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: profile of a rotund monk facing R; hooked nose; thin crown of curly hair; resting PR arm across belly
inscription:
-- inscribed on mat in graphite, lower left: IV SAE L4[?]
-- in graphite on verso: a line with \"rf\" underneath it
medium: Pen and brown ink with wash on paper
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: in graphite on pale green, hand-ruled mat, lower right, by a later hand: [JB Isabey / Nancy 1767 †  Paris 1855]
title: Caricature of a Monk
